CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 20,1969, pg. 1 reads: "BCC Leaders and Marchers - The city's "Black Monday" demonstration march in behalf of the Black Construction Coalition's Drive to gain construction jobs for blacks was led by BCC leaders and included an estimated 10,000 persons. Preparing to lead the two hour march from Centre and Crawford Ave. were from the left, Michael Dismond [Desmond], executive director, Bidwell Cultural & Training Center; the Rev. Jimmy Joe Robinson, the center's director; Nate Smith of Operation Dig, and Atty Byrd Brown, head of the local NAACP."
TitMainTitle: Black Construction Coalition Black Monday demonstration with Rev. Jimmy Joe Robinson preparing to lead protest march, with Ron Davenport, Norman Johnson, Rev. Bill Powell, Bill Banks, Lloyd Bell, Mike Desmond, men in hard hats, and others carrying flags with wreath wrapped around fist motif, at Freedom Corner with St. Benedict the Moor church in background
CatSubject_tab: Picketing--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Robinson, Jimmy Joe.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.St. Benedict the Moor Church (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Desmond, Mike.Civil rights demonstrations--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.
